page.title: 05Farming-Ide Hill
page.content: {Henden Manor Farm} Consists ofabout 550 acres of grassland and woods. It is a dairy farm with a pedigree herd of Friesian cows. A specialty of the farm is a rare Breed stud of some 37 Caspian horses. They have 4 stallions, brood mares and foals. The Caspian is a small draught horse(not pony) from Iran with Arabian blood capable of carrying some 60kg all day and 90kg for short distances without damage. They are very hardy, wintering out in the open & growing a thick shaggy coat to protect them from the elements. They are bred for sale as carriage horses and can easily pull a coach with six adults.
